How can I get service and support?

Source: vignettes/chapter0_Support.Rmd
chapter0_Support.Rmd

GGIR is open-source software, and it does not come with service or support guarantees. However, as a user-community, you can collaborate and support each other through the GGIR google group or the GitHub issue tracker. Please use these public platforms rather than private e-mails such that other users can learn from the conversations.

Moreover, we provide online training options for using GGIR, along with the flexibility of single-support sessions and dedicated support tailored to your specific needs.

Training options for GGIR

Check our dedicated training website with more details and the option to book your training. Do you have questions about the training or the booking process? Do not hesitate to contact us via: training@accelting.com.

GGIR standard training

The GGIR standard training aims to train you in both the hands-on use and understanding of GGIRâ€™s key functionalities and algorithms for common use-cases. This is a 3-session x 2-hour training offered twice a year. We provide a detailed description of the pipeline that GGIR proposes for the analysis of accelerometer data. You can expect to learn about the origin and vision behind GGIR, how to configure it to your research needs, and the step-by-step functioning of the main algorithms used by GGIR to provide physical activity and sleep-related output.

R essentials for GGIR

The R essentials for GGIR is designed to train you in the basic R skills that you will need for using GGIR. If you have no or limited experience with R then this course is for you. This eminently hands-on practice training will show you how to install R, RStudio, and GGIR, together with the commands that you will be using when interacting with GGIR. This is a 2-session x 2-hour training that is always offered the week before the GGIR standard training to help you out to get the most of the experience.

Also of interest may be the brief free R introduction tutorial.

Private training in GGIR

Are you already involved in a (or various) research project(s)? Do you need a full training in GGIR with the flexibility to tailor the course to your specific interests and needs? Then check out our private training in GGIR! Here, we can teach you how to use GGIR in line with the GGIR standard training, but focus strongly on the aspects relevant to you. This is a 3-session x 2-hour training in which you and your lab colleagues are welcome to join the sessions. This training may include (but it is not limited to) discussions on the analysis plan for your dataset, revision or assistance to develop your R scripts, or explanations of specific GGIR algorithms that you might be using.

Extra GGIR support session

In the case that you already have used GGIR and feel like you do not need a full training on it, but still you could benefit from some help, then consider the extra GGIR support session. This is a single 90-minute session in which we will discuss your use of GGIR, answer specific questions, or address the challenges you may run into. This service is usually intended for those who have already participated in the standard or private GGIR training and feel the need for an additional session.

Dedicated support

If you need dedicated support with the use of GGIR, need someone to adapt GGIR to your needs, or would like a new functionality to be included in GGIR, then do not hesitate to contact us. Vincent van Hees and Jairo H Migueles are available as independent consultants.
